bibl.title: Despatch from Robert Scott Newton to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from U.S. Consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, Portuguese Africa, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.p:
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda
23rd April 1879

I have the honor to inform the Department that I leave this day for England via Lisbon per steamer "Benguella" in conformity with licence granted me for six months in your Despatch No. 71 of 22nd November 1878.
As Mr. Thomas the newly appointed Consul has not yet arrived, I have delivered over the Archives to the care of Mr Andrew Galbraith Colville who will act during my absence.

I have made up the accounts of this Consulate to todays date according to consular instructions, and have to advise my Draft on the Secretary
Secretary of the Treasury for $56.19 in favor of Mr Frederick A. Silva of Boston. Enclosed is form No. 120.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your most obedient Servant
Robt S Newton
Vice Consul

To the
Hon. F. W. Seward
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington, D.C.
